Topic.Title: Within 12 months, Widows 8 Tablets and Phones will be standard for Business customers...

Message.Msg: *sigh* even more schoolgirl hysteria. What CIOs want doesn't matter as much as it once did. CFOs want more productivity at less cost with greater security, and Windows just delivers too little with far too much maintenance cost and no security. The result is what is being called the "consumerization" of the enterprise. BYOD is the order of the day.

Message.Title: Chairman Ballmer … I Have a Question…
Message.Msg: First of all, congratulations for a quite good financial results achieved by Microsoft in Q1 2013, surprisingly contradicting predictions of many doomsayers. Kudos to you for quietly making progress and maintaining steady course in spite of unending hostile attacks by mostly negatively biased media and unfriendly financial expert/analysts community. Having expressed my appreciation for your accomplishments now I want to ask you a question to you. We all realize, how critically important W 8 and WP 8 success is for Microsoft future including a new generation of devices based on these OS. I’m absolutely convinced that success of WP8 devices is impossible without success of W8 OS. They are so closely interconnected and interdependent. Now time for my question: How could you possibly approve this TV ad… you know, the one with young crowd, each holding Surface tablet, shaking/jumping/dancing around this big table with young boy dancing/rotating on his head on the top, everything in wild party atmosphere. Maybe I’m old fashion traditionalist… call me as you wish… but, is this how we want to sell this product (Tablet Surface) to business community and mature adult customers ? C’mon, what is this? Somebody has a serious problem here. Trying to be respectful, I’d say, it’s got to be me who has a problem. Where is the old, good, common sense , critical thinking, healthy judgment. What happened to those values. Who at his right mind can advertise Surface Pro or even RT in commercial like that which btw, completely misses intended target audience . This simply is ridiculous ad, a total turnoff. It is like having some hard rock or rap group performing on (let’s say) MS shareholders meeting with all the institutional big shots present. I don’t want to completely discredit this TV ad, but the appropriate places for them might be, MTV, Disney Ch. Nickelodeon Ch or even Saturday morning children programs. After all Surface is light, handy, relatively small and easily fit into a backpack. Every time this ad is on TV, I begin to question the sanity of people who entrusted their money and often their future by owning the stock (MS, NOK) of companies whose marketing departments are being run by unbelievably incompetent people. This commercial is simply a disgrace. Shame on you Microsoft! In spite of last quarter good results I worry about your and your partners (Nok) future. Mr. Ballmer this situation requires immediate correction. There’s plenty of highly talented and competent people out there …Mr. Ballmer, Mr. Ballmer, one more thing, in case if you need a good, creative consultant… you know how to find me, contact Yahoo Message Board .

Topic.Title: Chairman Ballmer … I Have a Question…

Message.Msg: YOU raise some good points and I agree that commercial was ill advised and was intended to portray Surface Pro as a cool product going directly after AAPL's marketing scam.... However MSFT does not make "toys", we make "tools" for business and consumers alike.... ON S. Ballmer, he is the most underestimated CEO (Please note our Chairman is Bill Gates) and most attacked by the paid bashers on Wall Street to defend AAPL and Google.... MSFT runs over 80% of the Enterprise PCs and that the decision to develop Windows 8 was a strategic one to not only to catch up with Mobility (Phones/Tablets) but also to integrate Desktop and Mobility.... This was in direct response to S. Jobs' assertions that PC is dead, long live Tablets.... Now Microsoft has turned the table around with Windows 8 thus advocating the death AAPL and Google.... In essence as Windows 8 gains a foothold in the Tablet market (The Windows 8 Phones are on their way to become a force in that Market already) and the Desktop/Mobility integration becomes "more evident", as I said in my earlier post, the CIOs would want to have a single OS platform for Data/Audio/Video and as MSFT Office 365 and Bing get more traction with corporate clients, we will see astronomical demand for Windows based tablets and a move away from AAPL and Google sponsored OS. Cheers Osso

Topic.Title: Why does MSFT do so little to help "partner"" Nokia??? MSFT should just buy out NOK while....

Message.Msg: Too late to buy YHOO, (that train left) but if they had last year and still had 43% of of Alibaba, along w/ recent gains for Yahoo Japan, and the synergies of combining Bing and MS net w/ YHOO, etc. they would have really scored big. They can still buy NOK cheap and really get into good tablets and phones before NOK decides it better start going Android as MSFT "partnership" not working out.

Topic.Title: Chairman Ballmer … I Have a Question…

Message.Msg: I think that is what is happening now.... ONE thing is for certain as Wall Street is very worried about the success of Windows 8 and even the folks at the IDC were blaming Windows 8 for "poor" PC sales.... THE fact is the PC sales are not based on the success of Windows 8 as the corporations each have their own refresh cycle(s) and if they have up-to-date PCs that can run Windows 7 or 8 they do not need to rush and buy a new machine and the same goes for consumers as I just bought a new PC after 6 years and migrated from Windows XP to Windows 8 and man what a awesome upgrade.... THERE is no doubt that Windows 8 will be a Grand Slam with all bases loaded as Tablets powered by it would be gaining ground in the corporate world and with its unmatched security features, there would be no need for anti-Virus software any longer.... SO the stakes are huge and the rewards for MSFT shareholders are immense.... IT is also very funny that paid bashers by APPL and Google are asking S. Ballmer to be fired as he is enemy number one for the Wall Street's phony technical analysts. Cheers Osso

Topic.Title: Ghoul Obama Broadens His Support Of Infanticide

Message.Msg: There's nothing wrong with my reading skills. It's your intellectual skills and moral outlook that's the problem. The subject is infanticide, aka murder of an innocent human being. It happens that the babies in question are very young, but murder statutes and civilized moral standards don't make exceptions for the age of a human being. It is murder to kill a 40 year old or a 4 minute old human being. Abortion has lead to ever increasing levels of depravity and a major breakdown in civilization. It leads to further levels of debauchery such as support of partial birth abortion and infanticide by Obama and many of his followers. The argument they present is that the baby is only a few hours old so its ok to kill her .... but that's just another push of the boundary further toward murdering inconvenient children up to age 4 or 5 years and old folks who have outlived their usefulness. Be careful, you may someday fall victim to Obamacare's death squads.

Topic.Title: Ghoul Obama Broadens His Support Of Infanticide

Message.Msg: You are ill informed about the "legal" limits of abortion. There are none. Abortion is legal throughout the entire pregnancy for any reason or for no reason at all. There is no bottom to the hell hole in which abortion dwells . Pro-lifers don't kill babies and they don't kill abortionists either. They are pro-life; they respect all human life, even that of abortionists and infanticide supporters such as Obama. We simply believe that all human beings have a right to life, and that includes babies still in the womb ... since they are beings of the human kind, perhaps smaller and younger than you and I but just as human.

Topic.Title: Picking Off Democrat Felons One at a Time
